abstract: A memory control unit for handling data stored in a memory device includes a first interface to an interconnection with at least one memory bank; a second interface for communicating with a data requesting unit; and a memory quantization unit. The memory quantization unit is configured to: obtain, via the first interface, a first weight value from the at least one memory bank; quantize the first weight value to generate at least one quantized weight value having a shorter bit length than a bit length of the first weight value; and communicate the at least one quantized weight value to the data requesting unit via the second interface.
summary: <SOH> SUMMARY <EOH>In an aspect, there is provided a memory control unit including: a first interface to an interconnection with at least one memory bank; a second interface for communicating with a data requesting unit; and a memory quantization unit. The memory quantization unit is configured to: obtain, via the first interface, a first weight value from the at least one memory bank; quantize the first weight value to generate at least one quantized weight value having a shorter bit length than a bit length of the first weight value; and communicate the at least one quantized weight value to the data requesting unit via the second interface. In another aspect, there is provided a method for quantizing data stored in a memory device. The method includes: upon receiving, at a memory control unit, a quantized data request, obtaining a first weight value from the memory device; quantizing, with a memory quantization unit, the first weight value to generate at least one quantized weight value having a shorter bit length than a bit length of the first weight value; and communicating the at least one quantized weight value to a data requesting unit. title: SYSTEMS, METHODS AND DEVICES FOR DATA QUANTIZATION
